newsitem.title: BELGIUM: CMB WEAKENS ON FIRMER BRUSSELS BOURSE.
newsitem.headline: CMB WEAKENS ON FIRMER BRUSSELS BOURSE.

text.p: Shares in Belgian shipping group CMB fell further on Tuesday after details of 1996 results published at the weekend showed CMB's 1996 profit to be more disappointing than preliminary figures had shown, analysts said.
By 1230 GMT CMB shares were 95 francs or 3.6 percent lower at 2,545 francs, after shedding 20 francs on Monday.

"The indicative current earnings figure of 1.65 billion francs or 178 francs a share published in February did not show the impact of all exceptional items and will now have to be revised by analysts to some 100 francs a share," Generale Bank said in a research note.

"The indicative current earnings figure of 1.65 billion francs or 178 francs a share published in February did not show the impact of all exceptional items and will now have to be revised by analysts to some 100 francs a share," it added.
Generale Bank and others pointed out a net profit of about 60 million Belgian francs on the sale of ships which was considered as belonging to current results.
CMB is also sensitive to the dollar, which weakened Monday.
"In the longer term, though, we're not that negative," added Generale Bank Securities analyst Luc Van der Elst.
One reason was that current excess in shipping capacity would decrease, making for higher freight rates.
